tit.cmt: ハイフン及び（名古屋帯）を削除しました。

sen.j: 名古屋帯（なごやおび）とは日本の女帯の一種。
sen.e: Nagoya-obi is a kind of Japanese onna-obi (a broad sash for a female).
The Nagoya obi is a kind of Japanese woman's obi (sash).
sen.cmt: Nagoya-obi を The Nagoya obi に修正しました。Onna-obi (a broad sash for a female) を woman's obi (sash) に修正しました。
sen.e: The Nagoya obi is a kind of Japanese woman's obi (sash).
It has become popular since the Meiji era.
It has become popular since the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: era を period に修正しました。
sen.e: It has become popular since the Meiji period.

sen.j: 名前の由来は、考案した呉服屋の馴染みだった名古屋の芸者が身につけていたことから。
sen.e: This name derived from the fact that geisha in Nogoya who was an old friend of gofukuya (kimono shop), the designer, wore it.
This name derived from the fact that a geisha (Japanese professional female entertainer at drinking party) in Nogoya who was an old friend of gofukuya (kimono shop), the designer, wore it.
sen.cmt: geisha を a geisha (Japanese professional female entertainer at drinking party) に修正しました。
sen.e: This name derived from the fact that a geisha (Japanese professional female entertainer at drinking party) in Nogoya who was an old friend of gofukuya (kimono shop), the designer, wore it.

sen.j: あるいは、名古屋女学校（現在の名古屋女子大学）の創始者越原春子が考案したともいわれている。
sen.e: However, some say it was designed by Haruko TSUKAHARA, the founder of Nagoya Girl's School (currently, Nagoya Women's University).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: However, some say it was designed by Haruko KOSHIHARA, the founder of Nagoya Girls' School (currently, Nagoya Women's University).
sen.cmt: TSUKAHARA を KOSHIHARA に修正しました。Girl's を Girls' に修正しました。Currently, のカンマを削除しました。
sen.e: However, some say it was designed by Haruko KOSHIHARA, the founder of Nagoya Girls' School (currently, Nagoya Women's University).

sen.j: このように諸説あり、「名古屋帯」という名称は使わず、「なごや帯」と称する場合もある。
sen.e: As there are various views, it is also written "なごや帯" (Nagoya-obi) instead of "名古屋帯" (Nagoya-obi).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: As there are various views on the origin of the name, it is also written 'なごや帯' instead of '名古屋帯.'
As there are various views on the origin of the name, it is also written 'なごや帯' instead of '名古屋帯.'

sen.j: このことからヤフーオークションのカテゴリーは「なごや帯」となっている。
sen.e: Under such circumstances, "なごや帯" is being used for the category title of Yahoo Auction.
Under such circumstances, the Yahoo Auction uses 'なごや帯' for its category title.
Under such circumstances, the Yahoo Auction uses 'なごや帯' for its category title.

sen.j: 体に巻きつける部分(前帯)を最初から半幅帯のようにに折りたたんで縫い付けてあるのが特徴である。
sen.e: Its characteristic is that a part of obi which is to be fastened around the body (maeobi) is made by sewing a folded textile as with hanhaba-obi (a half-width sash).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Its characteristic is that a part of obi which is tied around the body (mae obi) has been made from the beginning by sewing a folded textile like the hanhaba obi (half-width sash).
Its characteristic is that a part of obi which is tied around the body (mae obi) has been made from the beginning by sewing a folded textile like the hanhaba obi (half-width sash).

sen.j: お太鼓を結び上げた状態では遠目には袋帯と区別しにくい。
sen.e: When it is fastened in otaiko knot (drum knot), it is hardly distinguished from fukuro-obi (double-woven obi) from a distance.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: When it is fastened in otaiko knot (drum knot), it is hardly distinguished from the fukuro obi (double-woven obi) from a distance.
sen.cmt: fukuro-obi を the fukuro obi に修正しました。
sen.e: When it is fastened in otaiko knot (drum knot), it is hardly distinguished from the fukuro obi (double-woven obi) from a distance.

sen.j: 錦などでも仕立てられ、外出着や略礼装にも用いられる。
sen.e: Nishiki (brocade) is also used as material, and such products are used for street clothes and semiformal dresses.
Nishiki (brocade) is also used as material, and such products are used for street clothes and semi formal dresses.
sen.cmt: semiformal を semi formal に修正しました。
sen.e: Nishiki (brocade) is also used as material, and such products are used for street clothes and semi formal dresses.

sen.j: 形状から、袋帯と比べると帯結びの自由度は低い。
sen.e: Due to its shape, it lacks flexibility in tying an obi compared with fukuro-obi.
Due to its shape, it lacks flexibility in tying an obi compared with the fukuro obi (double woven obi).
sen.cmt: fukuro-obi を the fukuro obi (double woven obi) に修正しました。
sen.e: Due to its shape, it lacks flexibility in tying an obi compared with the fukuro obi (double woven obi).

sen.j: 種類は、仕立てる前の織物の幅によって次のように大別される。
sen.e: As shown below, Nagoya-obi is roughly categorized into two types based on the width of textiles.
As shown below, the Nagoya obi is roughly categorized into two types based on the width of textiles.
sen.cmt: Nagoya-obi を the Nagoya obi に修正しました。
sen.e: As shown below, the Nagoya obi is roughly categorized into two types based on the width of textiles.

sen.j: 九寸名古屋帯(帆布の帯芯を入れて仕立てる)
sen.e: Kyusun (27.27 cm) Nagoya-obi (it is made using obishin (padding of obi) of sail cloth)
Kyusun (27.27 cm) Nagoya obi (sewn with an obishin [padding of obi] made of sail cloth)
sen.cmt: Nagoya-obi のハイフンを削除しました。(it is made using obishin (padding of obi) of sail cloth) を全文修正しました。
sen.e: Kyusun (27.27 cm) Nagoya obi (sewn with an obishin [padding of obi] made of sail cloth)

sen.j: 八寸名古屋帯(帯芯を入れず単純に折り返し、縫い合わせる)
sen.e: Hassun (24.24 cm) Nagoya-obi (it is made without using obishin and it is sewed using a folded textile)
Hassun (24.24 cm) Nagoya obi (simply folded over and sewn together without an obishin)
sen.cmt: Nagoya-obi のハイフンを削除しました。it is made without using obishin and it is sewed using a folded textile をsimply fold over and sew together without obishin に修正しました。
sen.e: Hassun (24.24 cm) Nagoya obi (simply folded over and sewn together without an obishin)

sen.j: (お太鼓の部分の幅は何れも鯨８寸となる。）
sen.e: (the width of the portion of otaiko is hassun, measured by kujirajaku (a measure used in kimono-making), for both types.)
(the width of the portion of otaiko is hassun, measured by kujirajaku (a measure used in kimono-making), for both types.)
(the width of the portion of otaiko is hassun, measured by kujirajaku (a measure used in kimono-making), for both types.)
